title.narrative: 6. HEALTH IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: as per HAC Plan for Burkina Faso, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Women of childbearing age, pregnant women, newborns, boys and girls under age 5 years and adolescents use quality health services at health facilities and in communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: as per HAC Plan for Burkina Faso

description.narrative: In the double context of the humanitarian crisis and COVID-19 pandemic, continuity of health services in six most affected regions was crucial to ensure that IDPs and the most vulnerable population have access to minimum services. As such, 219,575 children under 14 were immunized with all antigens including 120,717 against measles. A total of 392,202 children and women benefited from essential health care especially at community level and 21,500 displaced households received long-lasting insecticidal nets.UNICEF supported the government in the process of devolving decentralized care and in the deployment of COVID-19 vaccines in the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
